017package org.microbean.interceptor;
018
019/**
020 * An interface indicating that its implementations can supply an
021 * {@code int} indicating a relative priority (smallest number wins;
022 * "quality is job one"; "first place"; "X is your first priority").
023 *
024 * <p>Note particularly that a negative priority trumps a positive
025 * one.</p>
026 *
027 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
028 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
029 *
030 * @see #priority()
031 */
032public interface Prioritized extends Comparable<Prioritized> {
033
034
035  /*
036   * Static fields.
037   */
038
039
040  /**
041   * The default priority returned by the default implementation of
042   * the {@link #priority()} method.
043   */
044  public static final int DEFAULT_PRIORITY = 0;
045
046
047  /*
048   * Instance methods.
049   */
050
051
052  /**
053   * Returns the priority for this {@link Prioritized} implementation.
054   *
055   * <p>The smallest number "wins" ("quality is job one"; "first
056   * place"; "X is your first priority").</p>
057   *
058   * <p>Note particularly that a negative priority trumps a positive
059   * one.</p>
060   *
061   * @return the priority for this {@link Prioritized} implementation
062   */
063  public default int priority() {
064    return DEFAULT_PRIORITY;
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Returns a negative {@code int} if this {@link Prioritized}
069   * implementation is considered to be less important than the
070   * supplied {@link Prioritized}, {@code 0} if it is considered to be
071   * of equal importance, and a positive {@code int} if it is
072   * considered to be more important.
073   *
074   * @param other the {@link Prioritized} to compare against; may be
075   * {@code null}
076   *
077   * @return a negative {@code int} if this {@link Prioritized}
078   * implementation is considered to be less important than the
079   * supplied {@link Prioritized}, {@code 0} if it is considered to be
080   * of equal importance, and a positive {@code int} if it is
081   * considered to be more important
082   */
083  @Override // Comparable<Prioritized>
084  public default int compareTo(final Prioritized other) {
085    return Comparator.INSTANCE.compare(this, other);
086  }
087
088
089  /*
090   * Nested classes.
091   */
092
093
094  /**
095   * A {@link java.util.Comparator} that compares {@linkplain
096   * Prioritized#priority() priorities}.
097   *
098   * <p>Instances of this class are consistent with equals.</p>
099   *
100   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
101   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
102   */
103  public static final class Comparator implements java.util.Comparator<Prioritized> {
104
105
106    /*
107     * Static fields.
108     */
109
110
111    /**
112     * The sole instance of this class.
113     *
114     * @nullability This field is never {@code null}.
115     *
116     * @threadsafety The value of this field is safe for concurrent
117     * use by multiple threads.
118     */
119    public static final java.util.Comparator<Prioritized> INSTANCE = new Comparator();
120
121
122    /*
123     * Constructors.
124     */
125
126
127    private Comparator() {
128      super();
129    }
130
131
132    /*
133     * Instance methods.
134     */
135
136
137    /**
138     * Returns a negative {@code int} if the first argument is
139     * considered to be less important than the second argument,
140     * {@code 0} if it is considered to be of equal importance, and a
141     * positive {@code int} if it is considered to be more important.
142     *
143     * @param p0 the first {@link Prioritized}; may be {@code null}
144     *
145     * @param p1 the second {@link Prioritized}; may be {@code null}
146     *
147     * @return a negative {@code int} if the first argument is
148     * considered to be less important than the second argument,
149     * {@code 0} if it is considered to be of equal importance, and a
150     * positive {@code int} if it is considered to be more important
151     */
152    @Override
153    public final int compare(final Prioritized p0, final Prioritized p1) {
154      if (p0 == null) {
155        return p1 == null ? 0 : 1;
156      } else if (p1 == null) {
157        return -1;
158      } else {
159        return p0.equals(p1) ? 0 : Integer.compare(p0.priority(), p1.priority());
160      }
161    }
162
163  }
164
165}
